Hi! Being very new to unit testing and TestDrivenDevelopment, Im
having a conceptual problem (mental block) putting things together
(and might get cleared up by my just writing this out, in which case
you won't be reading this ;-). Im hoping someone can hand hold me
through my problem:

The business domain problem Im trying to solve is simple:
If "Customer"'s last "Order" was greater than $100,
    then record the fact that they are eligible to receive a gift
    with their next order.

So I start out with a new class, say GiftManager and start out with 2
tests:

/* is a Customer eligible to get a Gift? */
public void testGiftEligibility() {
    GiftManager GM = new GiftManager();
    Customer customer = new Customer("joe@...");
    assertTrue(GM.eligibleForGift(customer));
}

/* add Gift to customer */
public void testAddGift() {
    GiftManager GM = new GiftManager();
    Customer customer = new Customer("joe@...");
    GM.addGift(customer);
    assertTrue(customer.getGift());
}

So for the first test to succeed we need a "Customer" joe@...
and that customer needs to have associated with it "Order"s where the
last order was greater than $100. Now since you can't tie this test
to an actual customer (the test would fail and pass over time
depending on customers last order), here is where you would use Mock
objects to create a fake customer with mock orders where last order is
greater than $100. All well and good.

But what do I do about test 2? Here is where my head is all muddled
and I don't know what I want:

So Im coding this new requirement where I want to record if some
customer has a gift associated with them or not.
Im doing test first development, I've coded the interface I want to
use in the test, and the whole point of testing this is to rest
assured that I can "addGift()" to a customer correctly, in other words
I want to rest assured that I've __implemented__ "addGift()" correctly.

I decide Im going to create a new table in the database something as
simple as customer_gift which has a customer_id and a gift_id
and addGift( customer ) will create a Gift object and then create a
record in this table with the respective customer_id and associated
gift_id.
So addGift() will write to the database and
customer.getGift() will be implemented to read the said data from the
database.
So what do I do here, create a fake Customer in the production db?
(Ideally have a test db where this isn't a problem?) Maybe create a
fake customer on test setup and then clean it out during teardown? If
my test breaks I may be littering fake data in the real db.
Whats the strategy to use here?
Help!


thanks,
mbil
